metadata.title: CVE-2017-7674 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The CORS Filter in Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.0.M21, 8.5.0 to 8.5.15,8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.44 and 7.0.41 to 7.0.78 did not add an HTTP Vary headerindicating that the response varies depending on Origin. This permittedclient and server side cache poisoning in some circumstances.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7674` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.78-1
No subscription required

libservlet3.1-java - 8.5.21-1
libtomcat8-embed-java - 8.5.21-1
libtomcat8-java - 8.5.21-1
tomcat8 - 8.5.21-1
tomcat8-admin - 8.5.21-1
tomcat8-common - 8.5.21-1
tomcat8-examples - 8.5.21-1
tomcat8-user - 8.5.21-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.0.78-1').
tomcat8 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.5.21-1').
